results.title: L'etoile du Nord = the North Star
results.creator_credit: WDR La Sept Cinema and Pierre Granier-Deferre
results.brief_description:
After years of aimlessly wandering around Northern Africa, Edouard Binet is sailing back to Europe. On board, he encounters the beautiful Sylvie and introduces her to Nemrod, a successful merchant, who is carrying a valuable jewel. After disembarking, Edouard accepts Sylvie’s offer to stay at her mother’s pension in Belgium. At the pension, Edouard’s charm endears him to Sylvie’s aging, lonely mother, Madame Baron. The stories of his fabulous adventures do much to ease her ennui. When they read in the papers that Nemrod has been murdered during a train trip to Paris and his valuable gem stolen, Sylvie begins to suspect that Edouard may have had something to do with Nemrod’s death. Awards: French Academy of Cinema: Best Supporting Actress: Fanny Cottencon; Best Writing - Adaptation: Jean Aurenche, Pierre Granier-Deferre, Michel Grisolia.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Pierre Granier-Deferre ; writers, Pierre Granier-Deferre, Jean Aurenche, Michel Grisolia ; photography, Pierre-William Glenn ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Philippe Noiret, Fanny Cottencon, Julie Jezequel, Jean Rougerie.

results.title: L'eternel Evade = the Elusive Prisoner
results.brief_description:
Inspector Flambart is escorting a chain of convicts taking Vidocq back to the prison for the fourth time. Vidocq and his two accomplices manage to break away from the chain gang. Flambart immediadelity launches the chase to re-capture them, but Vidocq has found a safe haven with a most welcoming milkmaid.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Seiler, Mario David.

results.title: L'enfant Invisible = the Invisible Child
results.brief_description:
A young boy is enjoying a pleasant holiday in a beautiful villa by the sea. One day, he meets a young transparent girl, who only he can see and starts playing with her.

Credits: Director: Andre Lindon ; writer, Andre Lindon ; music, Ronan Girre, Jean-Jacques Rulhmann ; animators, Andre Lindon, Muriel Petit, Mickael Volaris.

results.title: L'enfance Nue = Nude Childhood
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Mag Bodard, Claude Berri and Maurice Pialat
results.brief_description:
Ten year old Francois, abandonned by his mother, is sent to a working-class foster family where his behaviour becomes rather disturbing. After several incidents, he is sent to an other family. The parents are elderly, the grandmother ancient and a foster brother awkward and shy. The placement proves a success, although it eventually leads to a crisis. After a decade in televison, Pialat made his directorial debut with a New Wave style drama of adolescence featuring a cast of non-professional players. Such films, ten years after the arrival of the ‘nouvelle vague’, had become a kind of recognized genre unto themselves rather than a striking gesture of independence from established norms, and it is not surprising that Pialat’s work often led him in other directions. Reference: Alan Williams. “Republic of images: a history of French filmmaking”. Harvard University Press, 1992. Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1969.

Credits: Producers, Claude Berri, Mag Bodard, Francois Truffaut ; director, Maurice Pialat ; writers, Maurice Pialat, Arlette Langman ; photography, Claude Beausoleil.
Cast: Michel Tarrazon, Linda Gutemberg, Raoul Billerey, Pierrette Delplanque.

results.title: L'ecume des Jours = the Froth of Time
results.creator_credit: Philippe Senne, Andre Michelin and Charles Belmont
results.brief_description:
Colin, a rich and sentimental young man loves Chloe. His friend Chick shares his passion for literature and neglects his girlfriend Alise. Nicolas, driver and cook, is watching over this peaceful ‘world’. Colin’s life would be perfect, if only Chloe was not suffering from a mysterious disease.

Credits: Producers, Andre Michelin, Philippe Senne ; director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles belmont, Philippe Dumarcay, Pierre Pelegri ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Andre Hodeir.
Cast: Jacques Perrin, Marie-France Pisier, Sami Frey, Alexandra Stewart, Annie Buron, Delphine Seyrig.

results.title: L'Ecole Buissonniere = I Have a New Master
results.creator_credit: Pierre Laurent, Pierre Corti and Jean-Paul Le Chanois
results.brief_description:
At the end of WWI, Pascal Laurent, a young teacher, is sent to replace a retiring teacher in a small village of Provence. Pascal is keen on replacing the old authoritarian method of education with a new pedagogy. The children are soon won over, but Pascal’s unorthodox methods meet with the resistance from both his superiors and his students’ parents.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Corti, Pierre Laurent ; director, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; writer, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; photography, Marc Fossard, Maurice Pecqueux, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Juliette Faber, Edouard Delmont, Marcel Maupi, Edmond Ardisson, Henri Poupon, Gaston Modot, Lucien Callamand.

results.title: L'eau a la Bouche = to Each His Own
results.brief_description:
Milena lives with her grandmother in the Chateau d’Aubarede. At the death of the old woman, Milena invites two cousins, Seraphine and Jean-Paul, to attend the reading of the will. Seraphine arrives first accompanied by Robert, her lover, who decides to pass for Jean-Paul. Robert is fascinated with Milena and falls in love with her. As a means of revenge, Seraphine seduces young Miguel, the family lawyer. Then Jean-Paul arrives … The films contains several reference to classic films such as ‘La regle du jeu’ (Renoir, 1939) and ‘Smiles of a summer night’ (Bergman, 1958)

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; writer, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; photography, Roger Fellous ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernadette Lafont, Michel Galabru, Alexandra Stewart, Francoise Brion, Gerard Barray, Paul Guers.

results.title: L'aventure de la Voile (Ep.3)
results.brief_description:
In this episode we learn about the gallows that were used as war machines well into the 17th century. This episode also covers the famous battle that oppsed Sr francis Drake to the Invincible Armada of the King of Spain. This episode also announces the changes heralded by the arrival of steam engines aboard commercial ships.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: L'auberge de la Mer Tranquille = the Inn of the Quiet Mother
results.brief_description:
Annette and Vidocq are enjoying a moment of rest at the Inn of the Quiet Mother. But their peace is disrupted by the arrival of a chain gang. The captain of the chain is Vidocq’s old ennemy, capitaine Thierry. Things take a turn for the worse when a convict recognises Vidocq.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Alric, Sacha Briquet, Marcel Charvet, Alain Janey, Dominique Zardi.

results.title: L'atalante [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from the last film directed by Jean Vigo, which tells the story of a young skipper of a barge who takes on board his newly-wed country girl, and their slow trip up the Seine towards Paris. The film relates their early love, disillusion, separation and final reconciliation. This extract deals with their separation. Suitable for upper secondary level.
